intro: Olimarabidopsis pumila, commonly known as the desert mouse-ear cress, is a small flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with hairy stems and small, rounded leaves. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Olimarabidopsis pumila is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, showcasing features such as deep root systems and drought-resistant foliage.
